title: Rodemi
author: Rodemi
content: I previously owned a test jig for the S9 and it worked for the Antminer S9 and some 17 series hash boards. But recently it has rested. I want to buy a new jig and I want to be able to use it on the S19. No suitable ones have been found so far. I was wondering what do you use to test 19 series hash board?

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: I already give you a link from your previous threads you should also notice the test fixture from ZeusBTC but if you don't know yet then check this Antminer universal chip fixture test fixture.This support almost all Antminer units to test hashboard. And if you still asking for something related to repairing all you need is already on ZeusBTC so learn how to use the search button from their website.

comments.author: MinerMEDIC
comments.body: Yes buy the fixture from Zeus just don’t buy the touchscreen model, it’s a hot mess. You can also fix Your test fixture with one of Zeus’s generic S11/15/17 Zynq boards.

comments.author: Rodemi
comments.body: Thanks for the reply. I did notice this test fixture from ZEUS before, but I only saw its introduction picture was no marked S19, so it was ignored at the time.Quote from: BitMaxz on July 27, 2022, 02:00:50 PMAntminer universal chip fixture test fixture.Entering from this link, I see that S19 is mentioned in the introduction. Thanks for the reminder.

comments.author: Rodemi
comments.body: Quote from: MinerMEDIC on July 27, 2022, 10:35:14 PMjust don’t buy the touchscreen model, it’s a hot mess. Does touch screen model mean "2022 new version Antminer test fixture with touch screen"? Why is it mess? I'm thinking of buying the generic or this new version, can you speak more clear? I want to know. thanks.

comments.author: MinerMEDIC
comments.body: My first one broke on the first day and the screen never scrolls to the last few lines, you constantly have to be touching it to see the final output. I fixed mine with a generic S17 board from them. The convenience of portability is negated by the quirks. It’s just a mess but it is completely functional. The one pro I will add about this machine is it has a dedicated board inside that takes ATX power and runs pt2 test fans.

comments.author: Rodemi
comments.body: Thanks for your reply. This helped me, I think I'll buy a generic test fixture to use first and keep watching this.
